meanings.definition: Capable of being permeated or penetrated.
meanings.sent1: The sponge was permeably soaked with water.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was permeably dyed in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The paper towel was so permeably absorbent, it soaked up the entire spill in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was permeably open to new experiences, allowing joy to flow in.
meanings.sent5: The fog was permeably thick, making it hard to see more than a few feet ahead.

meanings.definition: Allowing liquids or gases to pass through easily.
meanings.sent1: The mesh material was permeably breathable, allowing air to flow through.
meanings.sent2: The membrane was permeably designed to filter out impurities from the water.
meanings.sent3: The balloon was so permeably inflated that it popped with the slightest touch.
meanings.sent4: The forest was permeably alive with the sounds of nature, carrying through the air.
meanings.sent5: The soil was permeably porous, letting water seep through to nourish the roots.
